content.description: Start low down matched on crack underclings. Head straight up to a sloper shelf and do a move out right to a jug.
Starts low down on jug underclings and moves up left into a jug slot. Continue going left and link into the same top as Perma
content.location: Just right of Perma, middle of the face

pathTokens: Burr Pond State Park / Paugnut State Forest

content.description: 15 feet tall, 60 feet wide boulder that’s moderately overhanging with a flat and clear landing area, smooth slopers, a wide variety of horizontal and full-height diagonal cracks, long and low traverse lines, solid undulating flakes, underclings and sidepulls, bands of vibrant crystals, chimney squeezes, safe top-outs and easy downclimbs - this is one of those boulders you dream of finding. One of the most aesthetically beautiful boulders in the park, and a great the east-facing view overlooking the valley.  The same world-class pink granitic gneiss as the rest of Walnut Mountain, the Pink Granite Maze zone, and other areas of southern Paugnut State Forest.  Coming soon - there are likely 10-15+ good-to-excellent lines on this.
